## DEBIAS 
DEveloping a framework to measure and correct BIASes in human mobility data extracted from digital footprints.   
:::
::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-lg-8 .top-story-img}
![](images/logo-white.jpeg)
:::
:::

</a>

:::
:::

::: {.header-text} 
::: {.content-container}
::: {.header-block}
**DEBIAS** is one of [seven projects](https://www.sdruk.ukri.org/2024/05/21/funding-new-smart-data-research/) funded by the [Smart Data Research UK programme](https://www.sdruk.ukri.org/about-smart-data-research/) through their £1.8 million research investment. Smart Data Research UK is the national programme for smart data research. Its mission is *"to unlock the power of data to improve lives"*.

A key problem with mobility data derived from digital technologies is that they can be biased, over-representing certain groups and under-representing others. This can make it difficult to determine how applicable research findings are to the overall population. DEBIAS aims to develop a way to quantify and adjust existing biases in smart data on human mobility so that research can be trusted and more broadly adopted.
:::
:::
:::
